chapter.title: Report PDF Parameters Module
chapter.para: As an administrator at a bank, you use the Report PDF Parameters module to set up parameters such as logo, header and footer texts for PDF documents generated from custom reports.

section.title: Parameters Function
section.para: This module consists of one function called Parameters, which is in the Report Designer part of the System Features menu.

note.para: This should not be confused with the Parameters section of the Report Designer form, which is described in the Report Designer chapter.

section.para: When you click this function, you are presented with a blank form.

section.title: Parameters Form
section.para: The form is as follows. After entering the details, click Save at the bottom of the form.

entry.para: Open a form where you can upload an image file containing a logo to display on reports. On the form, click the Browse button to enter the filename, then click Upload..
The logo should be a GIF, JPG or PNG image. The recommended size is 50x150 pixels.
We recommend you generate a test report in PDF format to check the logo is rendered correctly, and adjust the logo size and reload.
Text to appear next to the logo at the top of the page, on the left hand side. Three lines of 35 characters.
Text to appear in the centre of the footer. Up to 65 characters.
